newsitem.title: POLAND: SOCCER-CITKO SAYS HE WON'T BE JOINING BLACKBURN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CITKO SAYS HE WON'T BE JOINING BLACKBURN.

text.p: Poland striker Marek Citko said on Tuesday he would not be joining English premier league side Blackburn.
Citko, who plays for Polish champions Widzew Lodz, said personal issues and loyalty to his present club had influenced his decision.
"I am staying in Widzew...with the club to which I owe so much," said Citko after returning from talks with Blackburn officials.
"I am not concerned with financial matters and I want to help my club win the championship and the cup."
Widzew president Andrzej Pawelec said he fully understood Citko's decision. "Widzew can afford not to sell him," he added.
He confirmed that a deal worth between 2.6 million and four million pounds sterling ($4.2 million and $6.4 million) had been discussed in England.
